item.title: 特朗普希望加州大学洛杉矶分校支付 10 亿美元以解冻研究基金
item.description: 特朗普政府正在向加州大学洛杉矶分校寻求超过 10 亿美元的资助，以换取释放美国上周冻结的 5.84 亿美元联邦研究资金。【原文：The Trump administration is seeking more than $1 billion from the University of California at Los Angeles in exchange for releasing $584 million in federal research funding that the US froze last week.】

item.description: 私人信贷的大腕们多年来一直在等待这一刻的到来。【原文：The heavy hitters of private credit have been waiting for this moment for years.】

item.title: 怪客前往阿拉斯加
item.description: 大家好，欢迎收看《奇货可居》时事通讯，这里每天都有来自《奇货可居》的精彩内容。有时是我们乔-韦森塔尔（Joe Weisenthal）和特蕾西-阿洛维（Tracy Alloway）为您带来我们对市场、金融和经济最新发展的看法。有时是我们的专家嘉宾和消息来源网络提供的内容。不管是什么，我们保证永远有趣。【原文：Hello and welcome to the newsletter, a grab bag of daily content from the Odd Lots universe. Sometimes it's us, Joe Weisenthal and Tracy Alloway, bringing you our thoughts on the most recent developments in markets, finance and the economy. And sometimes it's contributions from our network of expert guests and sources. Whatever it is, we promise it will always be interesting.】

item.title: 指挥阿波罗 13 号的航天英雄詹姆斯-洛弗尔逝世，享年 97 岁
item.description: 詹姆斯-洛弗尔（James Lovell）逝世了，这位美国宇航员先驱曾执行过两次戏剧性的登月任务，其中包括阿波罗 13 号。享年 97 岁。【原文：James Lovell, the pioneering US astronaut whose two dramatic missions to the moon included Apollo 13, the nearly disastrous trip that captivated the world and decades later inspired a triumphant Hollywood blockbuster, has died. He was 97.】

item.title: 美国页岩钻井平台增加一个，打破连续 14 周下降趋势
item.description: 页岩油生产商在连续 14 周减少钻井平台后，本周又增加了一个钻井平台，至少目前避免了美国石油生产活动出现大范围下滑。【原文：Shale oil producers added a single drill rig this week after 14 consecutive weeks of declines, staving off at least for now a pandemic-level downturn in US activity.】

item.title: 据称贝恩资本将考虑出售 Ahlstrom 公司并在阿姆斯特丹上市
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，贝恩资本（Bain Capital）正在探索芬兰纤维特种材料公司Ahlstrom的各种选择，包括可能的首次公开募股或出售，估值高达80亿欧元（约合93亿美元）。【原文：Bain Capital is exploring options for Ahlstrom, a Finnish fiber-based specialty materials company, including a potential initial public offering or a sale valuing it at as much as €8 billion ($9.3 billion), according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美国移动首席财务官称将考虑用欧元再融资
item.description: 首席财务官卡洛斯-加西亚-莫雷诺（Carlos Garcia Moreno）表示，作为再融资工作的一部分，America Movil SAB 正在考虑发行欧元债券，以利用较低的利率。【原文：America Movil SAB is considering to issue euro-denominated debt to take advantage of lower rates as part of its refinancing efforts, chief financial officer Carlos Garcia Moreno said.】

item.title: 伦敦金银业贸易协会（LBMA）表示正在寻求对美国海关近期裁决的澄清
item.description: 伦敦金银市场协会（London Bullion Market Association）表示，该协会正在寻求美国海关和边境保护局（US Customs and Border Protection）对近期金条互惠关税裁决的澄清。【原文：The London Bullion Market Association said it’s seeking clarification on the recent US Customs and Border Protection ruling on reciprocal tariffs for gold bars.】

item.title: 卡尼提高士兵薪资，使加拿大更接近北约目标
item.description: 加拿大总理马克-卡尼（Mark Carney）领导的政府宣布大幅提高军人工资，此举将推动加拿大更接近实现北约的国防开支目标。【原文：Prime Minister Mark Carney’s government announced a major pay increase for military members, a move that pushes Canada closer to meeting its NATO defense spending target.】

item.title: 世界贸易组织认为美国前装导致全球贸易放缓的可能性较小
item.description: 世界贸易组织预测今明两年全球商品贸易将受到抑制，称贸易活动仍受到唐纳德-特朗普总统对美国进口商品征收关税的影响，同时提高了对2025年的预期。【原文：The World Trade Organization predicted subdued global merchandise trade this year and next, saying activity remains clouded by President Donald Trump’s tariffs on US imports, while lifting its estimate for 2025.】

item.title: 医疗科技公司 Heartflow 在 3.17 亿美元首次公开募股后大涨 66
item.description: 心脏病人工智能软件平台 Heartflow Inc. 在首次公开募股中募集到 3.17 亿美元后，股价大涨 66%。【原文：Heartflow Inc. shares surged 66% after the artificial intelligence software platform focused on heart disease raised $317 million in its initial public offering.】

item.description:
Frost Giant Studios 的目标是制作《星际争霸 II》的后继者，但迄今为止，这条道路一直困难重重

。【原文：

item.title: 美国法院系统最新黑客攻击事件让人回想起 2020 年 SolarWinds
item.description: 2024 年 9 月 5 日，星期四，美国俄勒冈州波特兰市马克 O. 哈特菲尔德美国法院。Kroger Co.和 Albertsons Cos.超市称，它们需要合并来与更大的竞争对手亚马逊公司、好市多批发公司和沃尔玛公司竞争，而联邦贸易委员会则称，合并将导致消费者的食品杂货价格上涨，超市工会员工的工资降低。摄影师：Elayna Yussen/Bloomberg【原文：The Mark O. Hatfield United States Courthouse in Portland, Oregon, US, on Thursday, Sept. 5, 2024. Kroger Co. and Albertsons Cos. supermarkets say they need to combine to compete against bigger rivals Amazon Inc., Costco Wholesale Corp. and Walmart Inc., while the Federal Trade Commission alleges the tie-up would lead to higher grocery prices for consumers and lower wages for the supermarkets' unionized workforces. Photographer: Elayna Yussen/Bloomberg】

item.title: 哥伦比亚黑客攻击影响 87 万人，其中包括一些健康数据
item.description: 根据哥伦比亚大学向美国国家官员提交的报告，该校计算机系统最近遭到入侵，包括学生和申请者在内的约 87 万人的个人信息遭到泄露。【原文：A recent breach of Columbia University’s computer systems compromised personal information of about 870,000 people, including students and applicants, according to the school’s reports to state officials in the US.】

item.title: 纽约警告预算缺口达 340 亿美元，为 2009 年危机以来最大缺口
item.description: 纽约州主计长托马斯-迪纳波利（Thomas DiNapoli）表示，由于联邦资金投入放缓，纽约州三年的累计预算缺口已增至 340 亿美元，比州长凯西-霍楚尔（Kathy Hochul）1 月份的估计增加了 25%。【原文：New York state’s cumulative three-year budget gap has swelled to $34 billion, rising 25% from Governor Kathy Hochul’s estimate in January as federal funding slows, Comptroller Thomas DiNapoli said.】

item.title: 检查显示智利铜矿的破坏比最初想象的严重
item.description: 上周，Codelco 公司最大的铜矿发生坍塌事故，造成的损失似乎比最初想象的还要严重，而且坍塌范围还扩大到了该巨型地下矿井的一部分，而这部分矿井当时正在全力生产。【原文：Damage from last week’s collapse at Codelco’s biggest copper mine appears to be worse than first thought and extends to a section of the giant underground complex that was in full production.】

item.title: 以太币突破 4,000 美元，ETF 资金流入和国债需求支撑涨势
item.description: 以太币自 12 月以来首次突破 4000 美元，原因是投资者流入现货交易基金的资金激增，以及在资产负债表上建立代币库存的公司对以太币的需求不断增长。【原文：Ether climbed past $4,000 for the first time since December, lifted by surging investor flows into spot exchange-traded funds and growing demand from companies building up stockpiles of the token on their balance sheets.】

item.title: 应税地方政府债券在低迷的小额债券市场中大放异彩
item.description: 在市政债券回报率低迷的一年里，需要缴纳联邦所得税的债务是一个亮点，因为该行业新的销售量不足，推动了收益的增长。【原文：The bright spot in a lackluster year for municipal-bond returns is debt subject to federal income taxes, as a dearth of new sales in the sector fuels gains.】

item.title: 集装箱商店聘请顾问解决库存难题
item.description: 据熟悉情况的人士透露，集装箱商店正在与伯克利研究集团（Berkeley Research Group）合作，因为该零售店正面临盈利下滑的困境。【原文：The Container Store is working with Berkeley Research Group as the retail store wrestles with flagging earnings, according to people familiar with the situation.】

item.title: 法国葡萄酒产量将增长 17%，但野火仍是威胁
item.description: 2025 年，法国的葡萄酒产量可能会比去年增长 17%，因为去年法国各地的种植区都受到了恶劣天气的影响。【原文：France’s wine production may rise as much as 17% in 2025 compared with last year, when adverse weather hit growing regions across the country.】

item.title: 华尔街日报》称特朗普政府准备房利美和房地美上市
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周五报道，特朗普政府正准备出售房利美（Fannie Mae）和房地美（Freddie Mac）的股份，最早可能于今年开始发售。【原文：The Trump administration is preparing to sell shares of Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac in an offering that could start as early as this year, the Wall Street Journal reported Friday.】

item.title: 热浪对欧洲核电供应的威胁与日俱增
item.description: 欧洲各地的热浪正在增加核电厂停运的必要性，预计未来几十年情况将进一步恶化，而缓解热浪的方案却寥寥无几。【原文：Heat waves across Europe are increasing the need for nuclear power plants to be taken offline, with the situation expected to worsen in the coming decades and few options for mitigation.】

item.title: 波兰新总统以减税计划挑战总理
item.description: 波兰新任总统卡罗尔-纳夫罗基宣布了为有子女家庭减税的计划，这给波兰臃肿的预算带来了巨大压力，并为与政府的另一场冲突埋下了伏笔。【原文：Poland’s new President Karol Nawrocki announced plans to cut taxes for families with children, piling pressure on the country’s bloated budget and setting the stage for another clash with the government.】

item.title: 印度莫迪邀请俄罗斯普京在美国紧张局势下访问印度
item.description: 在与美国关系恶化之际，印度总理纳伦德拉-莫迪邀请俄罗斯总统弗拉基米尔-普京访问这个南亚国家。【原文：India’s Prime Minister Narendra Modi invited Russian President Vladimir Putin to visit the South Asian nation amid deteriorating relations with the US.】

item.title: 尼日利亚保险股因新法创近 20 年最大涨幅
item.description: 尼日利亚通过了一项新法律，要求各公司筹集新资本，并规定必须为财产和其他资产投保，此后，尼日利亚保险股创下了近二十年来的最大单周涨幅。【原文：Nigerian insurance stocks had their biggest weekly gain in almost two decades after a new law was passed requiring companies to raise fresh capital and making insurance for property and other assets mandatory.】

item.title: 美俄计划达成乌克兰停战协议，欧洲天然气收跌
item.description: 在有报道称华盛顿和莫斯科正在就停止乌克兰战争达成协议后，欧洲天然气价格抹去了涨幅。【原文：European natural gas prices erased gains after reports that Washington and Moscow are working on a deal to halt the war in Ukraine.】

item.title: 美联储穆萨莱姆称通胀仍是比就业更大的问题
item.description: 圣路易斯联邦储备银行行长阿尔贝托-穆萨莱姆表示，他支持决策者上周做出的保持利率稳定的决定，并补充说美国央行在通胀方面的任务仍有欠缺。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis President Alberto Musalem said he supported last week’s decision by policymakers to leave interest rates steady, adding the US central bank is still missing more on the inflation side of its mandate.】

item.title: Sezzle 自 2023 年触底以来已上涨 7000%。问题是为什么
item.description: 通常情况下，当一只股票在不到两年的时间里飙升超过 7000% 时，投资者都会知道其中的原因。但 Sezzle Inc.【原文：Usually when a stock soars more than 7,000% in less than two years, investors have some idea why. Then there’s the curious case of Sezzle Inc.】

item.title: JLR 母公司回击特朗普批评，坚持有争议的捷豹品牌重塑
item.description: 捷豹路虎的下一任首席执行官回避了美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的批评，坚称汽车制造商状况良好，客户对两极分化的捷豹品牌重塑反应积极。【原文：Jaguar Land Rover’s next chief executive officer shook off criticism from US President Donald Trump, insisting the carmaker is in good shape with customers responding positively to the polarizing Jaguar rebrand.】
